title: American_Top_40_1986_September_20th
description:
"We're counting down the weeks biggest hits and the hits don't stop 'till we reach the top."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Max Headroom has a song at number 40 and Don Johnson (Miami Vice) has a song at number 20.

One listener wrote in saying that when the band Brelin hit number one, he wondered how many other acts named for cities had ever hit number one. Casey says there were six others!

Casey answers the question, "What recording act has had the most top 40 hits in a single calendar year?" Casey says the year was 1964, the act had 19 top forty hits and 6 number one's that year, and they are in this countdown!

After Rolling Stone Magazine called Phil Collins the cabbage patch kid of rock 'n' roll, people started throwing cabbage patch dolls on stage during his performances. Casey tells how Mr. Collins responded to all that.

Casey lists six television network actors in leading roles who went on to hit number one on the pop chart. 

There is only one song title in the rock era that has ever hit number one three times. The song that did it the third time is in the top 10.

One singer in the countdown got a "cease and desist order" from a judge to stop him from singing songs about Jesus in church. When he decided to continue, the media heard about it, the Today Show sent cameras, and this singer got his big break.
